ngoList.title: Snow leopard conservancy India
ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Marmot survey in Gangless, Horzey Sakti Saboo Saspotsey Liker Ullay and Gya villages by researcher Dina Nisthar. Myanmar Snow Leopard Camera trap expedition for two and half months by Jigmet Dadul and KC Namgyal. Village interviews on livestock demography predator conflict and mountain dependency by Mohd. Raza. Agro pastoral survey in Gya Meru and Rumtsay village by Mohd. Raza. Survey on Animal Imagery in Tibetan Buddhist monasteriesin Leh Nubra Hanu Yokma, hanu Gogma Dha Dh.

sourceOfFunds.purpose: Livestock Enclosure improvement and community livestock insurance program. Built livestock corral in Photoksar, Saspotsey, Ullay, Nubra and Zanskar. Collected 5th premium of the community based livestock insurance program from the Saspotsey, Ullay, Yangthang and Tarutse. Deterrent light fixed in Tukla phu.

Provided new homestay in Chumathang, Khadpu and Mangu. Homestay training for new homestay operators. Rong homestay exposure trip to Zanskar for one week. Homestay evaluation in Sham and Rong All homestay operators meeting at SLCIT office to discuss various issues. Two-day training on Homestay at LEHO office as a Resource Person

Environmental education workshop and day-long field trip done in few schools. (JNV, Mahabodhi, Siddhartha, and four schools in Turtuk, Nubra) Nature Guide Training and Field trip to Tsokar for 3 days with 25 participants. Celebrated World Environmental Day. One week students for students workshop with college students that also included 3-day field trip to Photoksar village. Multiple skilled training in Rong and Sham area on neddle-felting, rock curving and carpet weaving.
The organization has mitigated human wildlife through constructing predator proof lifestock corrals. More than 7000 sq km area has been covered to estimate the snow leopard population in the region.

The organization has mitigated human wildlife conflict through constructing predator proof livestock corrals. It has supported over 180 homestays which gives an income generation opportunity to the local communities. It has trained over 300 artisans in promoting Ladakhi art and crafts. It has trained over 230 unemployed youth in nature guiding and many of these guides have become entrepreneurs in their own rights.

ngoList.title: Social Educational Cultural Preservation and Dvp Society
ngoList.actName: Societies Registration Act, VI of 1998(1941 A.D.)
ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: We have been able to increase the intake of students since our inception on an incremental basis year by year. Students of the school have been actively participating in various national day celebrations such as independence day republic day. Through the use of renewable energy for electricity generation and heating of waters for providing facilities to the children in school and hostel we have been a model for others in the mountainous region. We have been carrying out initiatives to educate.
